concept.title: OCS-based call redirection for VoLTE MO calls

section.title: Overview
section.p: For VoLTE calls there is a functionality to redirect a MO voice call to a configured destination using ABD table configuration. This is usually used by operators to route calls to DA and customer care 611.

section.title: Mapping table and custom data configuration
section.p: Configure appropriate custom data for device. ABD routing is be supported for either the global level or device level for VoLTE calls.
Configure a mapping table with Pattern Type as REGEX_PATTERN as follows:

sectiondiv.p: When a successful CCA is returned and a routing number is configured then the FUI is set as follows:

li.p: Final-Unit-Action AVP is set as REDIRECT
Redirect-Address-Type AVP is set to the SIP URL
Redirect-Server-Address AVP is set as a configurable string

sectiondiv.p: The Requested-Party-Address AVP is used for ABD routing determination. If this AVP is not populated, then Called-Party-Address AVP is used.

For a DA query call, the TAS is sent to the OCS as a DA indicator. For example, the TAS sends Primary Call Type = 14, Service Type != 59 (59 indicates DA transfer), and the Service Type is set to 35 (35 indicates ABD).
For a DA transfer call, there is no change to current behavior. TAS sends Service Type = 59 to the OCS.

If it returns true, then FUI for routing number is included for 4011 result in command level and only FUI related AVPs is included in category level.
